etymology.description: 黑(黑) (hēi, "black") simplified -> two dots replaced by one stroke
etymology.interpretation: The character 黒 is a simplified variant of 黑(黑) (hēi, "black"), created by merging the two original dots into a single stroke, akin to other simplifications in Japanese script reform.
etymology.simplification: This is a reform-based simplification where two dots in 黑(黑) (hēi, "black") were combined into one stroke, similar to how 毋(毋) (wú, "do not") simplifies 母(母) (mǔ, "mother").

examples.chinese: 这本书的封面是黑(黑)的。
examples.pinyin: Zhè běn shū de fēngmiàn shì hēi(黑) de.
examples.english: The cover of this book is black.

examples.chinese: 夜幕降临时(夜幕降臨時)，公园里变得黑漆漆(公園裡變得黑漆漆)。
examples.pinyin: Yèmù jiànglín shí(夜幕降臨時)，gōngyuán lǐ biàn dé hēi qī qī(公園裡變得黑漆漆).
examples.english: When night falls, the park turns pitch black.
